newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Pertamina says oil explorers' expenditure to rise.
newsitem.headline: Pertamina says oil explorers' expenditure to rise.

text.p: Indonesian state oil company Pertamina said on Tuesday that expenditure by oil companies contracted to explore and develop reserves in the country will rise to $4.30 billion in 1996 from $2.89 billion in 1995.

"Oil contractors will spend $4.30 billion in 1996, including $3.02 billion for development and production and $686 million for exploration spending," Sungarna Sukandar, deputy chairman of Pertamina's foreign contractor management body, told reporters.
Other expenditure will be taken up by general and administration expenses.
Expenditure by foreign oil companies on development and production was $2.09 billion in 1995 and exploration spending was $427 million.
"The spending will support oil exploration in Indonesia and will maintain current production," Sukandar said.
OPEC member Indonesia currently produces 1.60 million barrels per day of crude oil and condensate.
